entries.title: What’s behind the energy spat between Canada, Mexico and the US?
entries.description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has said Mexico has 'inalienable' ownership of its energy resources.

entries.title: FTX teams in US, Bahamas to coordinate crypto recovery efforts
entries.description: The move resolves a dispute that was threatening the recovery of billions of dollars in lost funds.

entries.title: Biden awards medals to US Capitol officers on Jan 6 anniversary
entries.description: Law enforcement and election workers are honoured in a White House ceremony on the two-year anniversary of the riot.

entries.title: US rights groups slam Biden’s ‘unacceptable’ asylum restrictions
entries.description: New rules allowing US to turn more people away at border with Mexico ignore rights of asylum seekers, advocates say.

entries.title: Explainer: What is the Bradley Fighting Vehicle?
entries.description: The Bradley Infantry Fighting Vehicle is a tracked, medium-armoured vehicle armed with a 25-mm gun.

entries.title: Ukraine will need $1.79bn to restore telecoms sector: UN report
entries.description: Report from UN telecommunications agency reveals extent of damage done to Ukraine's communication networks by Russia.

entries.title: India’s economic growth to slow to 7%, government forecasts
entries.description: India remains a relative 'bright spot' in the world economy, but weak exports are expected to hamper its growth.

entries.title: New Mexico police probe gunfire at officials’ offices, homes
entries.description: US officials in the city of Albuquerque are looking into shootings reported near buildings connected to Democrats.

entries.title: Why have record numbers of people been leaving Cuba?
entries.description: Most have headed for the US over the border with Mexico, along with many thousands from other countries.

entries.title: Tesla cuts prices for second time in China as demand drops
entries.description: Tesla also slashes prices in Japan, South Korea and Australia but so far holds them steady in Europe and US.

entries.title: Kevin McCarthy fails again in US House speaker bid despite gains
entries.description: Several right-wing dissenters, who previously opposed the Republican leader, voted for him in the 12th ballot on Monday.

entries.title: US slaps sanctions on Iranian drone and missile production
entries.description: US has accused Iran weapons manufacturers of complicity in Russia's war in Ukraine, in violation of international law.

entries.title: Taliban leader accuses Prince Harry of killing innocent Afghans
entries.description: Taliban official alleges son of King Charles committed war crimes after he reveals he killed 25 people in Afghanistan.

entries.title: Mexico: 29 people dead in operation to arrest son of ‘El Chapo’
entries.description: Ten soldiers among those killed during arrest of drug kingpin's son, which sparks violence by cartel, government says.

entries.title: Even as US job growth solid in December, signs of cooling
entries.description: Hiring in December was smallest in two years, extending a hiring slowdown for most of 2022, aiding inflation fight.

entries.title: Israel approves punitive response to Palestinian moves at ICJ
entries.description: PA rejects Israeli measures, which include a moratorium on Palestinian construction in parts of the occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Despite outcry, Christmas blackface parade celebrated in Spain
entries.description: Calls are growing for the use of blackface characters in Alcoy's Three Kings Parade to be abandoned.

entries.title: Popcorn and memes: US Democrats find humour in ‘speakergeddon’
entries.description: With Republican infighting over speaker persisting, many Democrats shared lighthearted takes on the voting marathon.

entries.title: Hawaii’s Kilauea volcano erupts again
entries.description: Volcano on Hawaii's Big Island erupting just weeks after it stopped releasing lava from a previous eruption.

entries.title: January 6 Capitol riot: Charges, convictions, trials two years on
entries.description: More than 950 people are charged with federal crimes, some already convicted of serious charge of seditious conspiracy.

entries.title: Palestine: Unite or die
entries.description: Against a new far-right Israeli government, Palestinians need their leaders to unite, not repeat empty slogans.

entries.title: Basra excited ahead of Arabian Gulf Cup tournament kickoff
entries.description: The 25th edition of the Arabian Gulf Cup football tournament will start in Iraq on Friday.

entries.title: Why is Canada banning foreign homebuyers?
entries.description: Canada says new law aims to make housing more affordable but experts say other measures would better reduce high costs.

entries.title: Israeli police arrest two over Jerusalem cemetery vandalism
entries.description: Two teenagers are suspected of vandalising more than 30 graves at the Protestant Mount Zion Cemetery in Jerusalem.

entries.title: Prominent Kenyan LGBTQ activist Chiloba found dead in metal box
entries.description: Discrimination against LGBTQ people is common in Kenya which has a 14-year jail term for gay sex.

entries.title: Russia sends more troops to Belarus as fears of new attack grow
entries.description: Ukraine says Belarus could be used as a staging post by Moscow for an offensive from the north, opening up a new front.

entries.title: Botswana’s ex-leader Khama asks court to set aside arrest warrant
entries.description: The warrant was issued after Ian Khama failed to turn up in court to answer charges laid against him in April.

entries.title: What awaits Ukraine in 2023?
entries.description: Ukrainians are confident they will win the war, but fears of a renewed Russian offensive in 2023 are growing.

entries.title: Inflation making lives difficult for people in the Philippines
entries.description: For many Filipinos, the increasing cost of basic commodities was that of a 'developed nation'.

entries.title: Afghanistan signs oil extraction deal with Chinese company
entries.description: The contract is the first major foreign investment deal since the Taliban seized power in Kabul in 2021.

entries.title: Armed fighters kill six during village raid in Somalia
entries.description: The attack targeted a village in Hirshabelle State, which Somalia's army captured from al-Shabab last week.

entries.title: UN internal report flags rebels flouting ceasefire in eastern DRC
entries.description: There is uncertainty about the status of the conflict in parts of east DRC, although M23 rebels agreed to a ceasefire.

entries.title: Syria cholera outbreak may worsen if UN cross-border aid stops
entries.description: The UN Security Council will vote on Monday to renew an authorisation to transport aid across the border from Turkey.

entries.title: Italy’s football star Gianluca Vialli dies aged 58
entries.description: Vialli, who played with Sampdoria, Juventus and Chelsea, was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2017.

entries.title: HRW former head denied Harvard fellowship over ‘anti-Israel bias’
entries.description: Kenneth Roth, the longtime head of Human Rights Watch, had his fellowship offer rescinded.

entries.title: Big money is choking India’s free press — and its democracy
entries.description: The recent resignation of anchor and Modi critic Ravish Kumar underlines how monopolisation is threatening Indian media.

entries.title: China may ease ‘three red lines’ property rules: Bloomberg
entries.description: Strict lending rules were introduced in 2020 to tackle property developers' unbridled borrowing.

entries.title: Chad says it foiled ‘destabilisation’ attempt by officers
entries.description: A group of 11 officers, led by a human rights activist, was behind the attempt, according to a government statement.

entries.title: Air India slammed by regulator over handling of unruly passenger
entries.description: DGCA says the airline did not comply with provisions related to handling of passenger who urinated on a woman on board.

entries.title: Head of Russia’s Wagner mercenaries has eyes on Bakhmut mines: US
entries.description: White House official says Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin wants to control salt and gypsum from mines near Bakhmut.

entries.title: Samsung says it expects lowest quarterly profit in 8 years
entries.description: South Korean tech giant blames weak demand for memory chips for sharp decline in profits.

entries.title: Vietnam removes two deputy PMs amid anti-corruption campaign
entries.description: Stripping the two men of their positions comes as Vietnam's Communist Party intensifies fight against corruption.

entries.title: N Korea’s Kim reveals daughter in hint at extending family rule
entries.description: Kim Jong Un, who turns 39 on Sunday, is the third generation of his family to successively rule North Korea since 1948.

entries.title: Tried of the grind, China’s well-off eye slower pace in Thailand
entries.description: Chinese social media is abuzz with the benefits of moving to the Southeast Asian country after years of COVID curbs.

entries.title: UN Security Council stresses Al Aqsa status quo, takes no action
entries.description: Palestinian envoy: 'What red line does Israel need to cross for the Security Council to finally say, enough is enough?'

entries.title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy says Putin’s 36-hour truce is a tactical ploy
entries.description: Ukrainian leader says the war will end when Russian troops leave Ukraine or 'we throw them out'.
